This code chunk is part of the user interface initialization in a 3D modeling or CAD-like application. Specifically, it adds radio menu items for different views (top, front, left, and perspective) to the View menu, enabling users to switch between these standard orthographic and perspective views. The event handlers are set up to trigger the `onViewChange` method when any of these view options are selected, allowing the application to update the active viewport accordingly.

Context: This code is part of the UI initialization process where radio buttons for selecting different views (top, front, left, and perspective) are added to a menu. The event handlers call the onViewChange method to switch the active viewport.

menuItem = self.menuView.AppendRadioItem(ID_TOP_VIEW, self.MENU_TEXTS[ID_TOP_VIEW][0])
        self.Bind(wx.EVT_MENU, lambda p0=None, p1=0:self.onViewChange(p0, p1), menuItem)

        menuItem = self.menuView.AppendRadioItem(ID_FRONT_VIEW, self.MENU_TEXTS[ID_FRONT_VIEW][0])
        self.Bind(wx.EVT_MENU, lambda p0=None, p1=1:self.onViewChange(p0, p1), menuItem)

        menuItem = self.menuView.AppendRadioItem(ID_LEFT_VIEW, self.MENU_TEXTS[ID_LEFT_VIEW][0])
        self.Bind(wx.EVT_MENU, lambda p0=None, p1=2:self.onViewChange(p0, p1), menuItem)

        self.perspViewMenuItem = self.menuView.AppendRadioItem(ID_PERSP_VIEW, self.MENU_TEXTS[ID_PERSP_VIEW][0])
        self.Bind(wx.EVT_MENU, lambda p0=None, p1=3:self.onViewChange(p0, p1), self.perspViewMenuItem)
